title: Earth beyond six of nine planetary boundaries
summary: Quantitative assessment showing Earth has transgressed six of nine planetary boundaries, with climate change and biosphere integrity being core boundaries whose violation risks destabilizing the entire Earth system. Provides updated metrics and safe operating space definitions.
key_findings: Six planetary boundaries now exceeded
Climate change and biosphere integrity are core boundaries
Land use change and freshwater use approaching thresholds
Safe operating space is narrower than previously estimated

title: Global polycrisis: the causal mechanisms of crisis entanglement
summary: Systematic analysis of how crises interact and amplify across domains (environmental, economic, political, social). Identifies six causal mechanisms: common drivers, domino effects, feedback loops, resource competition, governance fragmentation, and perceptual biases.
key_findings: Six distinct causal mechanisms of crisis entanglement
Feedback loops create non-linear escalation
Governance fragmentation amplifies systemic risk
Prevention requires addressing root causes, not symptoms

title: The polycrisis is here, and system dynamics can help: a call to action
summary: Argues for system dynamics modeling as essential tool for understanding polycrisis interactions. Proposes methodological frameworks for modeling cross-domain feedback loops and intervention leverage points.
key_findings: System dynamics uniquely suited for polycrisis analysis
Need for cross-domain modeling approaches
Intervention leverage points can be identified
Policy coordination critical for effective response

title: Characterizing the global polycrisis: A systematic review of recent literature
summary: Comprehensive systematic review of polycrisis literature 2015-2024. Maps conceptual evolution, identifies research gaps, and proposes unified analytical framework for studying interconnected global risks.
key_findings: Conceptual evolution from 'perfect storm' to 'polycrisis'
Research gaps in quantitative interaction modeling
Need for integrated assessment frameworks
Policy implications understudied

title: Tipping point detection and early warnings in climate, ecological, and human systems
summary: Advances in early warning signals for critical transitions across multiple system types. Reviews indicator performance and proposes unified framework for anticipating tipping points before they occur.
key_findings: Critical slowing down precedes most tipping points
Universal indicators across system types
Warning times vary by system complexity
Intervention windows can be predicted
